nodes.body:
Changes in Lean4 have caused a regression that I think we should fix upstream first, so this bump is on hold for now.

EDIT: the regression has been fixed, and now we're waiting on Std4.

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover/std4#163~~
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#5584~~
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#5715~~
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#5729~~
* ~~leanprover/std4#173~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ü§ñ). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->

This bump makes `Nat.cast_ofNat` unavailable as a `simp` lemma.
`Nat.cast_ofNat` is used as a simp lemma by `norm_cast` to lift a numeral so this is a fatal regression.

Sorry, `Nat.cast_ofNat` is available as a `simp` lemma. It was my misunderstanding.
However, it is true that there is a regression that `norm_num` can't lift numerals.

Sorry to bother you over and over. `Nat.cast_ofNat` is often unavailable as a `simp` lemma.
It is neither absolutely unavailable nor simply available.

The cause of this problem is that a `DiscrTree.Key` which is used to match to `@OfNat.ofNat Nat 2 _` is changed from `.const OfNat.ofNat 3` to `.natLit (.natVal 2)`.
This would be fixed by registering `Nat.cast_ofNat` as a simp lemma with the modified `DiscrTree`.

Haha!üê≠(THE SUDDEN MICKEY) I found the useful term elaborator `no_index`. This gives terms a `noindex` metadata. The `DiscrTree` of terms with a `noindex` metadata becomes `.star`. It is no longer needed to register `Nat.cast_ofNat` as a simp lemma with the modified `DiscrTree`.

If recent commits doesn't conflict with this branch, it will pass the CI.
This bump PR was quite a heavy job, I nearly went mad.


By the way, look! a lot of Goofy are over there.

üê∂<ah-hyuck! üê∂<ah-hyuck! üê∂<ah-hyuck! üê∂<ah-hyuck! üê∂<ah-hyuck! üê∂<ah-hyuck! üê∂<ah-hyuck!

üê∂<ah-hyuck! üê∂<ah-hyuck! üê∂<ah-hyuck! üê∂<ah-hyuck! üê∂<ah-hyuck! üê∂<ah-hyuck! üê∂<ah-hyuck!
üê∂<ah-hyuck! üê∂<ah-hyuck! üê∂<ah-hyuck! üê∂<ah-hyuck! üê∂<ah-hyuck! üê∂<ah-hyuck! üê∂<ah-hyuck!

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

  Build succeeded!

  The publicly hosted instance of bors-ng is deprecated and will go away soon.

  If you want to self-host your own instance, [instructions are here][instructions].
  For more help, visit [the forum].

  If you want to switch to GitHub's built-in merge queue, visit [their help page][gh].

  [instructions]: https://github.com/bors-ng/bors-ng#how-to-set-up-your-own-real-instance
  [the forum]: https://forum.bors.tech

  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/5538053192/jobs/10107579794)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/5538053192/jobs/10107579702)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/5538053192/jobs/10107579875)
Could we have a note here? I'm confused why `aesop_cat` can't do the `dsimp` step.
Why are changes like this necessary?
Because `objX` is unfolded to the `match` expression now.
Why this change? This seems like it should work.

Because `Splitting.map` is unfolded in `simps` lemmas.
I wonder why `Splitting.map` isn't unfolded in the old Lean.
Okay, I added a comment to that effect.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore: bump to nightly-2023-07-01
